entry.title: High Wind Watch issued October 27 at 3:46AM AKDT until October 29 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...West to northwest winds 40 to 60 mph with gusts up to 80 mph possible. * WHERE...Eastern Aleutians. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through late Friday night.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Aleutians

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 26 at 10:32PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow South And East Of Fairbanks Through Thursday... Light snow occuring south and east of Fairbanks will continue through Thursday afternoon. Most areas south and east of Fairbanks will get 1 to 2 inches of snow through Thursday afternoon. The areas south of Delta Junction and east of Tok can expect 3 to 4 inches of snow. Snow should taper off Thursday night.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 26 at 3:07PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS AND HEAVY RAIN EXPECTED FOR PORTIONS OF SE ALASKA FOR THE WEEKEND... Potential for a storm force low and front moving into the AK Gulf from the SW early Saturday. The low will weaken as it moves eastward by Sunday. Strong winds will impact the northeast gulf coast and northern panhandle Saturday through Sunday as the low

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 10:52PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through early next week while continuing a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 10:47PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The St. Johns River above Lake Harney at Geneva remains in Major Flood Stage. The river is forecast to continue a slow decline, dropping from Major to Moderate Flood Stage by this weekend. Interests along the river will continue to see major flood impacts,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 10:45PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia
